page.title: 15Traffic in Sheering
page.content: The main road called{The Street carries traffic to the villages between Harlow and Chelmsford. Most of the vehicles are cars. There are some vans and light lorries. The busiest times of the day are the rush hours at 8.00 a.m. and 6.00 p.m. In the morning the cars are mostly going towards Harlow. The road through Lower Sheering carries local traffic only. The{M11 Motorway}was built 10 years ago. It goes between London and Cambridge. In the morning most of the traffic is going into London but by the middle of the day it is going towards Cambridge and most of it is commercial vehicles. We cannot get onto the M11 at Sheering. The nearest junction is at Harlow.
